meanings.def: a thing that is added to something else to improve or complete it
examples: vitamin/dietary supplements (= vitamins and other foods eaten in addition to what you usually eat)
supplement to something Industrial sponsorship is a supplement to government funding.
The farmer adds a supplement to the horse's feed.
women who take a daily supplement of folic acid
means-tested supplements to the basic pension

meanings.def: an extra separate section, often in the form of a magazine, that is sold with a newspaper
examples: Our special supplement is packed with ideas for healthy hair.

meanings.def: a book or a section at the end of a book that gives extra information or deals with a special subject
examples: the supplement to the Oxford English Dictionary
a supplement to the main report
You can use these books as supplements to the basic English course.

meanings.def: an amount of money that you pay for an extra service or item, especially in addition to the basic cost of a holiday
examples: supplement (for something) There is a £10 supplement for a single room.
supplement on something There is a supplement on rooms with a sea view.
at/for a supplement Safety deposit boxes are available at a supplement.
If you want to travel on a different day a flight supplement is payable.
We charge a small supplement for this service.

meanings.def: to add something to something in order to improve it or make it more complete
examples: supplement something with something a diet supplemented with vitamin pills
supplement something He supplements his income by giving private lessons.
